results.title: Good evil deeds
results.brief_description:
Good Evil Deeds (GED) is a short interactive Macromedia Flash animation about a young woman Audrey who’s doomed to an early death. Choices made in GED will send Audrey to one of three places in the afterlife: Hell, Purgatory or Heaven.
Inspired by the French film “Amelie”.

results.title: Good driving
results.creator_credit: Trident Films and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: British Railways operate thousands of road vehicles. Keeping them trouble-free and accident-free depends to a large extent upon the way they are handled by their drivers. The film shows typical delivery routes being covered by a lorry and by a “mechanical horse” and trailer, and some of the many circumstances in which care, common sense and alertness on the part of the driver can prevent accidents.

results.title: Good cleaning fun: housework down the years
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch, Bob Scarfe and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: An education officer from the Museum of Victoria looks at a number of “labour saving appliances” used in the home over the last one hundred and fifty years and looks at the development of laundry and kitchen appliances.

results.title: Gone up north for a while
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Ronald Bowie and Paul Maunder
results.brief_description: A girl finds herself pregnant. She has no hope of marriage but knows that when her baby comes she will not give it up. She doesn’t know, but soon finds out, that society has no real place for her, and no understanding of the special needs of the unmarried mother and her child.

results.title: Goliath II (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Walt Disney and Wolfgang Reitherman
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon about an elephant only five inches tall, whose parents are ashamed of him until he rescues the stampeding herd from an attacking mouse. Narrated by Sterling Holloway.

results.title: Golfers in a Scottish Landscape
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Edgar H. Anstey and Norman Prouting
results.brief_description: A tourist film of Scotland with information on Scotland’s golfing history and courses liberally interspersed between the normal tourist attractions.

results.title: Golf: history and tradition
results.brief_description: This dramatic video takes you on a pilgrimage to the heart and home of Scotland with a rare look inside the clubhouse at St. Andrews. Treasures of the past are revealed from feathery balls and longnose clubs, to the clubs in use today. See the development of golf course architecture by visiting the famous Link Courses.

results.title: Golf: a special kind of joy
results.creator_credit: National Golf Foundation and Tom Hilderbrand
results.brief_description: Part 1 of the Modern Golf Instruction series. Places importance on building a swing to suit each individual player. Looks at the role of each golf club in obtaining loft and length and demonstrates the use of each club group. The language of golf is discussed and the handicap system explained.

results.title: Golf: 50 steps to improve your game
results.brief_description: Hosted by professional golf teacher Richard Bradbeer and presented in 5 common sense sections - getting ready, getting started, getting round, getting out of trouble, and getting it in the hole, this tape provides 50 golfing tips for novices and experts alike. Addresses key golfing questions such as “How can I avoid the slice”? “What do I need?” “What’s the best way to tackle the ball?”. As well as many others.
